content:
After some discussion I suggest to have Inbox view and Recent conversations view. An attempt to join them makes a very complex user interface.

recent-conversations-01.png
Recent converstations:

  • Like now in terms of features
  • Any additional filtering is possible, I showed how even tabs are possible here

inbox-01.png
Inbox:

  • Grouped by stream, streams are in the same order as in the left side bar
  • No participants
  • the way such information is extracted is different, because these are all unread

@Alya Abbott told that Mute icon button shouldn't be among the options. I showed that its possible to show 1-2 buttons + 1 tricolon more button

dark-inbox-01.png
dark-recent-conversations-01.png

Cool!

Would we still use background colors to distinguish unread vs. read conversations? Could you post a screenshot that includes a conversation with no unreads?
How would we accommodate adding a stream filter to Recent conversations? (#18645)

I guess the tabs are just notional for now, but would let us link to a view like #feedback > recently viewed ? Do you have thoughts on putting them in the center (light theme screenshot) vs. left (dark theme screenshot)?
In a narrow window, would we move all three Recent topics checkboxes to their own line, similar to what we do now?

Fro the Inbox screen, according to Tim Abbott , it would be relatively easy to show participants who sent unread messages (if we like), but difficult to show the timestamp of the most recent message. So at least the initial version would not include "2 days ago", etc., though we could still sort by recency using message IDs.

Could we also add a button to collapse each stream in the Inbox view? Based on experience with mobile, there are situations where one has lots of unread topics in some stream, and it would be very helpful.

Would we still use background colors to distinguish unread vs. read conversations?
No, I suggest the counter to be unread indicator. Do you want to indicate participated?

How would we accommodate adding a stream filter to Recent conversations? (#18645)

I thought that input inside the filter could work on streams name too, so:
image.png

Alya Abbott said:

In a narrow window, would we move all three Recent topics checkboxes to their own line, similar to what we do now?

Yes

it would be relatively easy to show participants who sent unread messages (if we like)

Ok, so image.png
Subjectively I don't like the idea of showing avatars to be honest, but if you think this is the way to go in unread we can do that.
Showing avatars is a source of annoyance and bias.
If there is something unread in the topic you follow and you have time and desire to check it out why to introduce another factor of "who said that"? To mark all as read without checking?

Could we also add a button to collapse each stream in the Inbox view?

Do we still want the stream row to be clickable?
image.png foldable streams and userpics of people who recently posted

I am a user and not a developer in any way - I love this concept. An issue we currently run in to in our environment is inadvertently marking conversations (particularly private messages) as read without actually having the chance to read them. I think this would be an elegant way to solve that issue, as theoretically the conversation would not be marked as read until expanded.

On the avatars question - it only makes sense to me personally to see avatars on private messages. Streams often will have a large number of participants (again, in our environment) and the avatars won't mean anything. That said, it only showing avatars on unread messages would not detract from the use.
Here is the indication of participation image.png
or maybe outside the topic image.png
what do you think? I like the second version

I think the second image, where there's effectively an "I participated" column indicator, is easier to see and understand. Putting it in the topic name like in image one makes it blend in with the rest and less likely to draw your eye to something you've been involved in.
Mm, yeah, I think if we want to include a "participated" indicator, it would be better to put it outside the topic column (second verson), to make it clear that it's not part of the topic name.
I guess we could leave room for both that and an @-mention indicator?

Subjectively I don't like the idea of showing avatars to be honest, but if you think this is the way to go in unread we can do that.

I don't think it's crucial, but a possible use case if if you are waiting for a response from a particular person on a thread, or else if you want to be especially responsive to someone's messages (e.g. your boss).

Vlad Korobov said:

How would we accommodate adding a stream filter to Recent conversations? (#18645)

I thought that input inside the filter could work on streams name too, so:
image.png

Hmm, we should think about that UX... E.g. if you are looking for some topic and you remember what stream it was in, how would you do that?

if you are looking for some topic and you remember what stream it was in

If it is not the topic I remember, I probably should go into the left side and look for a topic name there? I did have problems with that in the past, but don't remember was it the search issue or my problem of inputing the term.

But if such topic exist on recent conversations screen I just input Stream name and search will show me all the lines where stream name or topic name matches that
Thanks for the work on this @Vlad Korobov! I like the generally clean look at feel that these have.

One thing that isn't really working for me in the "Inbox" view is the variable empty space on the right side of the rows:

image.png

I think my preference would probably be to cap the maximum width (as we do with the middle column in general ... at least in the absence of the "fluid width" setting) and then just have the controls adjacent to the unread count (or participants section if we're doing that).
(At least if we feel that doesn't create excessive distance between the unread counts and the labels on the left)

Hmm, what's the thinking behind using a bold font for the stream names in these prototypes? We had previous versions of Zulip where we used bold for the stream name where it appeared in the recipient bars in the message feed, and it was not popular because it drew the user's eye to the stream name, rather than the messages themselves. I think that is less of a valid criticism of using it here, but I'd still argue that the topic is probably more important information than the stream name in the recent conversations view, if we're going to emphasize something, but that it might look cleaner with a consistent font between the two, since that's what we're generally doing elsewhere? (E.g. in message recipient bars).

I think a core design tension for "recent conversations" is that on the one hand, we kinda want to display the stream/topic pairs like a message recipient bar for design consistency reasons, but on the other hand, the table design is ergonomic for sorting, filtering, and also just separating the streams from the topics for easier visual scanning.
(I definitely agree with the strategy of having these be separate views, as it'll make several things simpler, so thanks for pushing for that direction!)

I'm not sure I understand "variable empty space" concern.
In the recent conversations we could limit the max width of the container and make it center aligned. Its hard to say now the number of px it should be
image.png

For the Inbox we could shrink "the table" but I think we should agree if we are showing avatars there at all or not? My personal suggestion is to not show them in the Inbox view, to make it clean and light.
image.png

Another question is about which actions are we promoting to be right inside the table and which would go into more? The questions more about quantity of icon buttons there. We could make only 1 button on hover "mark as read" and the rest would be under the "more" button.

what's the thinking behind using a bold font for the stream names in these prototypes?

It is just visual hierarchy/UI-taste type of thing. Without bold streams things become just columns, but with bold streams we suggest the order of reading. It is not a big deal. If you feel that it shouldn't be bold ("topic is probably more important information") , we can make it regular
image.png

Vlad Korobov said:

Another question is about which actions are we promoting to be right inside the table and which would go into more? The questions more about quantity of icon buttons there. We could make only 1 button on hover "mark as read" and the rest would be under the "more" button.

Good question! If "Mark as read" using unread counters in Recent topics #21654 / #22219 works, out, we wouldn't need a "mark as read" button. In that case, I don't really see a need for anything besides the overflow menu there. I think all the other actions are rare enough to make it work fine.

I'm not sure about the "open link" button shown in the design... It might not be as useful in the Recent conversations view (i.e. before you had a chance to read the messages) than in the message feed? I guess it could also be placed at the end of the topic name column, which might make it feel more contextually connected.

"Mark as read" using unread counters

That is not a great way guys. I don't recommend that from UX/UI point of view. Counter isn't a button. It is not obvious that click on a counter removes a number... And we don't have such thing anywhere else in the app.
I think the plan is to try it out here... Totally possible we'll decide that it's not working out.
Even if you have that functionality… discoverability will be a problem. We will be forced ether to teach and be consistent or to have additional button :wink:
Yeah, I'm not sure how to solve for discoverability... In terms of consistency, we could make it work in the left sidebar as well.
I definitely don't suggest to do that. It's enough to have 1 button (more 3 dots button) inside another button (the whole row is a button )
Mm, that's a good point.
Are we going to implement a separate Mark as read button in recent topics?
That would just be reverting the commit where we removed it and moved the functionality to the unread counter.
@Vlad Korobov what is your thinking on how the combined stream / topic filter would work?
We should probably update the designs to include an @-mention indicator, since that seems to be working well on mobile and in the left sidebar.

Alya Abbott said:

Vlad Korobov what is your thinking on how the combined stream / topic filter would work?

just search through all of them at the same time

Alya Abbott said:

We should probably update the designs to include an @-mention indicator, since that seems to be working well on mobile and in the left sidebar.

I will

Alya Abbott said:

That would just be reverting the commit where we removed it and moved the functionality to the unread counter.

we should get back to that discussion

Vlad Korobov said:

Alya Abbott said:

Vlad Korobov what is your thinking on how the combined stream / topic filter would work?

just search through all of them at the same time

Ah, I mean on the user input side... Since we know they are filtering for a stream or topic, they shouldn't need to type stream:X stream:Y topic:Z as in the top search box, but how do we make it handy?

I think we do want to distinguish between stream and topic searches, to make it possible to, e.g., filter down to a single stream.

if I enter just a word I expect the match across all sorts of fields and it usually enough (probably 80% of cases).
If I know what I exactly want I might do the same as in regular search field stream:word or topic:word

Hmm, running with the single search box idea, what if you wanted to filter to two streams? I guess we don't let you do that in search currently, but I can see that being useful.

I also wonder if we could be helpful with auto-complete, e.g. by offering to auto-complete to stream names even if you haven't typed stream:.
Autocomplete should be smart and suggest things with or without prefix
That "filter to these 3 streams" use case is certainly why I'd imagined us using a multi-select "Streams" widget for recent conversations; that got stalled on implementation.

It's super exciting to be able to play with the Inbox view on CZO! A few initial thoughts:

  1. Would it be possible to preserve which streams are collapsed when you navigate away and come back to the Inbox view? I think that would be super helpful, and is definitely a feature I take advantage of in the inbox view on mobile.
  2. Similarly to mobile, should we sort pinned streams at the top?
  3. I'm not sure what the right solution is, but the amount of blank space on the right feels awkward to me.
Sorting pinned streams to the top certainly sounds correct to me.
Generally agree with the others as well. The space is of course because the original design had a participants column that we don't have the data to load immediately.
